qas.question: What cannot travel on Downtown Miami streets during "Bike Miami"?
How many people participated in Bike Miami in October of 2009?
Who was a recent mayor of Miami?
Along with Downtown, in what neighborhood of Miami does Bike Miami take place?
In what month in 2008 did Bike Miami start?
What can travel on Downtown Miami streets during "Bike Miami"?
How many people participated in Bike Miami in October of 2008?
Who was a non-recent mayor of Miami?
Along with Uptown, in what neighborhood of Miami does Bike Miami take place?
In what month in 2018 did Bike Miami start?

context: In recent years the city government, under Mayor <a2_0><b7_0>Manny Diaz<b7_0/><a2_0/>, has taken an ambitious stance in support of bicycling in Miami for both recreation and commuting. Every month, the city hosts "Bike Miami", where major streets in Downtown and <a3_0><b8_0>Brickell<b8_0/><a3_0/> are closed to <a0_0><b5_0>automobiles<b5_0/><a0_0/>, but left open for pedestrians and bicyclists. The event began in <a4_0><b9_0>November<b9_0/><a4_0/> 2008, and has doubled in popularity from 1,500 participants to about <a1_0><b6_0>3,000<b6_0/><a1_0/> in the October 2009 Bike Miami. This is the longest-running such event in the US. In October 2009, the city also approved an extensive 20-year plan for bike routes and paths around the city. The city has begun construction of bike routes as of late 2009, and ordinances requiring bike parking in all future construction in the city became mandatory as of October 2009.
